humanMachineDialogue.author: Memory Reasoning
humanMachineDialogue.text: The largest tumor is a Nottingham grade III ductal adenocarcinoma with a size of 5.5 cm, which falls in the T2 category (more than 2 cm but not more than 5 cm). The presence of multifocal tumors does not affect the T stage, and it is based on the size of the largest tumor. Therefore, the pathologic T stage of the patient's cancer is T2.

humanMachineDialogue.author: ZS Reasoning
humanMachineDialogue.text: The largest tumor in the right breast measures 5.5 cm in greatest dimension, which falls under the T2 category (T2: Tumor size > 2.0 cm and ≤ 5.0 cm). Although there are multiple additional tumors, the T stage is based on the size of the largest tumor.
